entry.title: IceCream Framework Part 4 :Function available in excel file and how to use!
entry.content:
Version Beta 0.1

Function Browser

1) Define : choose your browser you want to run your test case.

2) Available : Chrome , FireFox , IE.

3) Required : All browser must be install in your laptop or computer.

Function OpenUrl

1) Define : open the url you want to test.It will wait for the browser load this page success!

2) Available : with any url that publish to internet or your local network.

3) Required : correct the format of URL such as : www.anyurl.com or http/https://anyurl.com. Must put value in column ‘ACTION INPUT VALUE’.

Function CloseBrowser

1) Define : close the browser.

2) Available : All browser that you choose in the top of excel file.

3) Required : don’t need to put any value in ‘ACTION INPUT VALUE’ , ‘FIND BY’, ‘FIND BY VALUE’

Function Type

1) Define : type in text-box that you want.Return false if element is not display or not is text box or text arena.

2) Available : all text-box that visible in website.

3) Required :

‘ACTION INPUT VALUE’ : your value you want to type in text-box!

‘FIND BY’ : Choose once of options : ‘ID’ , ‘TagName’ , ‘ClassName’ , ‘Css Selector’ , ‘Xpath’ , ‘Link text’ , ‘Partial Link Text’

‘FIND BY VALUE’ : give the value like xpath of this text-box if you choose Xpath option in ‘Find By’.

4) Example : Let’s take a look in this html source below :

```

```

The scenario is find the textbox and type in it value ‘example’ by using function type in excel.

I choose the demo to you 3 option is :

A)Find by ID :

‘ACTION INPUT VALUE’ : your value you want to type.

‘FIND BY’ : ID

‘FIND BY VALUE’ : textbox (this is the id of this input type)

B)Find by Class name :

‘ACTION INPUT VALUE’ : your value you want to type.

‘FIND BY’ : Class Name

‘FIND BY VALUE’ : example(this is the class name of this input type)

C)Find by Xpath :

‘ACTION INPUT VALUE’ : your value you want to type.

‘FIND BY’ : Xpath

‘FIND BY VALUE’ : //input[id=‘textbox’] (this is the xpath of this textbox)

Function Click

1) Define : Click into button , link,.. etc! Return false if element is not displayed.

2) Available : All element is visible in website.

3) Required :

‘FIND BY’ : Choose once of options : ‘ID’ , ‘TagName’ , ‘ClassName’ , ‘Css Selector’ , ‘Xpath’ , ‘Link text’ , ‘Partial Link Text’

‘FIND BY VALUE’ : give the value like xpath of this element you want to click if you choose Xpath option in ‘Find By’.

4) Example : take a look in html source below

<td id='holder'> <a class='link_example'>Click here</a> </td>

The scenario is find the link and click in it.

I choose the demo to you 2 option is :

A) Find by Class name :

‘FIND BY’ : Class Name

‘FIND BY VALUE’ : link_example(this is the class name of this link)

B) Find by Link text :

‘FIND BY’ : Link text

‘FIND BY VALUE’ : Click here(this is the text in the link)

Function VerifyTitlePage

1) Define : compare the title page with the text user input.Return false if the title page not equal with the text user input.

2) Available : String for input.

3) Required : ‘ACTION INPUT VALUE’ : give your String to compare with the current title page.

Function VerifyText

1) Define : compare text inside element with text user input.Return false if they are not equals.

2) Available : String input.

3) Required :

‘ACTION INPUT VALUE’ : give your String to compare with the current text in element.

‘FIND BY’ : Choose once of options : ‘ID’ , ‘TagName’ , ‘ClassName’ , ‘Css Selector’ , ‘Xpath’ , ‘Link text’ , ‘Partial Link Text’

‘FIND BY VALUE’ : give the location of element like xpath, ID you want to compare.

Function SelectValueDropdown

1) Define : select the value of drop-down list via value user input.Return false if value is not existed in drop-down.

2) Available : String input.

3) Required :

‘ACTION INPUT VALUE’ : give your String Value you want selected in drop-down

‘FIND BY’ : Choose once of options : ‘ID’ , ‘TagName’ , ‘ClassName’ , ‘Css Selector’ , ‘Xpath’ , ‘Link text’ , ‘Partial Link Text’

‘FIND BY VALUE’ : give the location of drop-down like Xpath , or ID you want to select!

4)Example : take a look in html code below :

<select id='country'> <option value='vietnam'>Viet Nam</option> <option value='thailand'>ThaiLand</option> </select>

The scenario is select value Viet Nam in drop-down list. So this will be look like this :

‘ACTION INPUT VALUE’ : vietnam(value of option)

‘FIND BY’ : ID

‘FIND BY VALUE’ : country

Function SwitchToFrame

1) Define : switch the driver to iframe.

2) Available : All I-frame visible in website.

3) Required :

‘FIND BY’ : Choose once of options : ‘ID’ , ‘TagName’ , ‘ClassName’ , ‘Css Selector’ , ‘Xpath’ , ‘Link text’ , ‘Partial Link Text’

‘FIND BY VALUE’ : give the value to find the location of IFrame like Xpath , or ID you want to select!

Function SwitchToWindow

1) Define : if browser current have more than once tab , it use to switch to the another tab.

2) Available : All tabs are existed in current browser.

3) Required :

‘ACTION INPUT VALUE’ : name of this tab you want to come.

Function SwitchToDefault

1) Define : switch to the default tabs

2) Available : All tabs are existed in current browser.

3) Required : Just choose the function only , not required any parameters.

Function EnterAlertAcceptButton

1) Define : enter the accept button in Alert if alert present.

2) Available : all alert is present.

3) Required : just choose the function only , not required any parameters.

Function EnterAlertDismissButton

1) Define : enter the cancel button in Alert if alert present.Return false if alert is not present.

2) Available : all alert is present.

3) Required : just choose the function only , not required any parameters.

Function IsAlertPresent

1) Define : check if alert is present.Return false if alert is not present.

2) Available : all browser.

3) Required : just choose the function only , not required any parameters.

Function IsElementPresent

1) Define : check if element is present.Return false if element is not present.

2) Available : all element.

3) Required :

‘FIND BY’ : Choose once of options : ‘ID’ , ‘TagName’ , ‘ClassName’ , ‘Css Selector’ , ‘Xpath’ , ‘Link text’ , ‘Partial Link Text’

‘FIND BY VALUE’ : give the value to find the location of element like Xpath , or ID you want to check!

Function WaitElementPresent

1) Define : wait for element present in website with time out default is 10 second , you can set this timeout by enter in column ‘ACTION VALUE INPUT’.Return false if element not present.

2) Available : all element.

3) Required :

‘ACTION INPUT VALUE’ : time out you want to wait for this element.

‘FIND BY’ : Choose once of options : ‘ID’ , ‘TagName’ , ‘ClassName’ , ‘Css Selector’ , ‘Xpath’ , ‘Link text’ , ‘Partial Link Text’

‘FIND BY VALUE’ : give the value to find the location of element like Xpath , or ID you want to check!

Function WaitElementsInvisible

1) Define : wait for all elements invisible in the timeout.Return false if once of elements is not invisible.

2) Available : List elements.

3) Required :

‘ACTION INPUT VALUE’ : time out you want to wait for this element.

‘FIND BY’ : Choose once of options : ‘ID’ , ‘TagName’ , ‘ClassName’ , ‘Css Selector’ , ‘Xpath’ , ‘Link text’ , ‘Partial Link Text’

‘FIND BY VALUE’ : give the value to find the location of element like Xpath , or ID you want to check!

Function TakeScreenShot

1) Define : take a screen-shot in your current browser tabs and save it under folder ‘Screenshot’.

2) Available : all browsers.

3) Required : just choose only action and not required any parameters for this.

entry.title: IceCream Framework Part 3 : Running an example test case.
entry.content:
Running an example test case

Follow to there steps below :

1) Open IceCream folder.You will see the file ‘TESTEXAMPLE.xslx’.

3) Copy this file and paste to Folder TestCase then rename this file like you want.

4) Open this file you copied by Microsoft Excel.

5) In this file , I create my example test case is : Running in Browser Chrome , Open ‘http://facebook.com’ , wait for text-box password present in 5 second , then I type in text-box email , type in text-box password. Take a screenshot and close the browser.

5) First take a look in the top , you can able to set up browser you want to run this test case. The list provide you 3 browser : Firefox , IE , Chrome. Make sure that 3 browser is install in your laptop. Or you can download Firefox browser here , Chrome browser here. In this case , I choose my test case running in Chrome. You can set IE ,CHROME ,FIREFOX like you want.

6) Now take a look in row 3. I use the action ‘OpenUrl’ with value is ‘http://facebook.com’ , It mean that I will let browser access to url facebook.com and wait for the facebook.com load success.You can change whatever URL you like in this Action Input Value.

7) Take a look in row 4 . I use the action ‘WaitElementPresent’ with the Action Type Input is 5.It mean that I will wait 5 second for the Element that I find BY ID is pass present in this page.

8) You can see row 4- 8 some action , but I think you need to see the How to use Action in Excel

9) Now save and close this file.

10) Back to folder IceCream , double click in file ‘run.cmd’ and see the automation test process.

11) After automation test process success , check Report in folder Report and check the screenshot in folder Screenshot.

12) Now you can create your own test case by copy file ‘TESTEXAMPLE.xslx’ to the test case folder, rename this file , open this file , choose the browser , and delete row 3 to 8 and define your action in this excel file.We recommend you to take a look in How to use Action in Excel . If you have any trouble to set up and run your test case , leave your comment below.

entry.title: IceCream Framework Part 2 : Download and Configuration
entry.content:
DOWNLOAD

Required Tools (If you already have this in your laptop or computer , you can skip this step) :

1) Download and install Microsoft Office trial here : Link Download

2) Download and install JAVA here : How to download and install Java

IceCream Framework version (all version of framework) :

1) Version Beta 0.1 : Mediafire , Google Drive

2) Version Beta 0.2 hot fix test running in fire-fox browser :Google Drive , Mediafire

Configuration

You can follow in these step below :

1) Click on this link version of Icecream you want and wait for browser download this.

2) After download success , copy and paste the ‘Icecream.zip’ file to any location in your disk you want.

3) Unzip file ‘Icecream.zip’ by winzar or 7zip

4) You will see the folder ‘Icecream’ with inside it contain 3 folder : TestCase and Report and Screenshot , 1 file ‘IceCream.jar’ and 1 file ‘run.cmd’ and 1 file excel. Do not delete them.

5) Open file ‘run.cmd’ by Notepad++ or Notepad program

6) Copy the path to the folder ‘IceCream’ and paste to the ‘replace-it-with-your-path-to-folder-Icecream’

7) Save this file ‘run.cmd’.

Now you are finish the configuration , is it easy?

It’s time to know Running an example test case

entry.title: IceCream Framework Part 1 : Introduction
entry.content:
Introduction

IceCream FrameWork was launched to help the tester to run test automation website more easily.

The IceCream FrameWork installation very easy, just a few basic steps that you can run it.

Tester just have the basic understanding of XPATH Location and Excel files is enough to make one test automation programs running on multiple browsers.

In addition, it supports IceCream Framework Report for each test case are stored in the folder Report, the screen image was taken by the command will be stored in the folder Screen-shot to tester easily manage test case.

IceCream Framework is written by Java language and use the core Selenium WebDriver.

Currently IceCream Framework version 1.0 Beta version only have the basic functions to perform automatic chemical testing.

The reason for this because I want to collect more of your opinions, feedback and the desire to have more function for me so that I can write to serve you in the next version!

IceCream Framework is completely free to use for personal learning and doing the simple test case.If you like this framework , please share my blog to your friend or your partner!

If your company wants to use this IceCream Framework for automating the process of test sites or want to build your own Framework, please contact me via email: tabaolan1987@gmail.com or ping me via skype: lantb1987. I would be happy to discuss with you!

All the download links and installation instructions in my blog post I use Adfly to earn a bit of money to serve the development. Hopefully it will not bother you too much during your learning in my blog.

I named this framework is IceCream because it is the name of my first child. She was so cute and gentle, smile every time, so I hope this framework will also create a comfortable and cozy up to you.

Let IceCream say Hi with you and take a look in IceCream Framework : Download and Configuration
